XRay_Diffraction_and_Scattering.Description: Philips, Netherlands with Cu K alpha 1 radiation (lamda = 0.154056 nm) in a wide range of 2 theta (theta is between 5 degrees and 85 degrees.

Thermogravimetric_Analysis.Description: with alumina as the reference material

Electrometry.Description: The capacitance of the elctroded specimen was measured as a function of frequency (100Hz - 1 MHz) using an impedance gain phase analyzer at room temperature.  A two terminal capcitor configuration was employed for this measurement.
